description:
All the surrounding brunch places had long waits, so I came here instead. I was pleasantly surprised! Despite the poor reviews I saw on Yelp, this place was fast, efficient, and delicious!

We were seated right away, which was good because I was getting hangry. Ordered the godfather omelette. Out came a perfectly cooked egg, stuffed with Italian sausage, mushrooms, and peppers. Everything was flavorful and delicious (except the American cheese, which I would pass on next time). The hash browns were crispy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside. Went well with the hot sauce they provide. And of course, the meal wouldn't be complete without some sourdough toast -- which was served perfectly cooked, not burned. The staff was friendly and checked on us a few times, always offering to refill my coffee (which was surprisingly bold and flavorful! unusual for a diner type place).

I would definitely come back here next time I'm in the area. Great food, good prices, and good service.
author: Sara S.

description: I just paid $13.45 for a half Caesar salad with crispy chicken. The salad was so small,and the chicken was like chicken nuggets. RIDICULOUS waste of money. Also- there was a large puddle of water in the dining room next to our table the entire duration of our meal. Idiotic. DONT GO HERE.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Toast is a great option for a short wait and affordable breakfast/brunch in Noe Valley.

Usually when people say Noe Valley, I think yoga moms, bougie lifestyles, and eggshell/tan colors. We happened upon Toast by accident, since we originally planned on going to Griddle Fresh...but after eating realized it was Toast. How hilarious! Their signage says eat Toast, which is pretty cute and not as "telltale" of the name as I thought. All inside the space they have graffiti/street art by this famous SF artist and pieces of toast animated and pictured. The vibe is definitely family-friendly, and very cozy and low-key--exactly what we needed.

Boo was hungover from the night before, and I was pretty hungry and was looking for some hearty grub. We decided to share the regular french toast (with added fruit) and the salmon scramble which was SO delicious and great in portion size. We got the scramble with english muffins, so we essentially made our own benny's with scrambled eggs which tasted really good. The hash browns could have been served in greater amount, but they are crispy and yummy. They also have brunch items like benny's, sandwiches, pancakes, and the like.

Toast is actually as it is. There's nothing extra remarkable about it or the food. Our server was a kind girl who seemed to have so many tables to keep track of. She got her job done, but we didn't get any homey treatment because they did seem understaffed. The only things that could be improved are the house coffee (said the boo) and perhaps providing heaters for outdoor seating. However, Toast is more like a diner than a SF breakfast place...which is a great option especially in Noe Valley.
author: Jodi H.

description: Good burrito! But would not recommend coming after 2 (closes at 3), I did feel rushed out the door
author: Jose R.

description: We walked in 10 minutes before closing and welcomed us super friendly and loving ! Did not feel rushed and got excellent service!
author: Karen G.

description: This place is a joke. So expensive and lackluster food. I've eaten here a few years aand was disappointed, but thought I'd give it another try since it's been several years.  I ordered a burger with no bun for $13.95. It was about a centimeter thi pretty much impossible to cook to medium rare. Came without any of the condiments. Sent it back and excused myself. Will never be back. Can not believe they are still in business with all the great food options.
author: Heather H.

description:
I enjoyed the food here 
Their breakfast combo was well made 
Their coffee is okay 
Salads and sandwiches are good, while the sides are a little proxy for what you get 

The service is very good
author: Jad A.

description: The food is average and they are super disorganized. Busy Sunday brunch time and they have a sign in list but without looking at the list they seat people off the street first (or let people just walking in sit down wherever they want and start serving them) as others who have been waiting awhile look on. Not worth it.
author: Urban C.

description:
I absolutely love this place. I was in Noe Valley running errands and was looking for someplace to have breakfast. I walked in and was warmly greeted and encouraged to pick a seat anywhere, so I grabbed a table by the window so I could people watch as I ate. The coffee IS SOOOOOO GOOD I'm still thinking about it. My server was friendly and warm and took great care of me. My lox benedict was fantastic, the fruit bowl was obviously fresh and had blueberries, strawberries, banana, and melon. I got there right before a big rush of people, but I didn't feel rushed at all and tipped extra for the consideration. 

I will 100% be back. Great job, TOAST.
author: Cristina B.

description: Why someone would eat here and keep this place open is beyond me.. okay the staff is OK .. friendly sure but the food .. no.. no way.. zero flavor.. obviously everything is frozen and old stock..old oil used for hash brown.. I am writing this sitting at the restaurant.. $ 14.50 for the complete crap breakfast  burrito and $15 for the eggs Benedict .. horrible and the coffee is bad ..  I am never coming back but this review is for others who are coming to the area looking for a snack.. please don't do the mistake I did.. don't go here .. go anywhere else.. even 7-11 has better food
author: Arvind R.

description:
Poor reviews of this place versus the other Toast location leads me to think that the owner does not visit this location as much as the other one.

I only come here when my husband wants the croissant French toast. It's always such a guessing game on what to get. I got the wet burrito before - bland, lack of good flavor. I got the regular breakfast combo with French toast and hot links today. 

The hasbrowns were stale, and my sausage was totally burnt. It's a good thing I flipped the sausage over to see how the other side was, or I would have had a nasty surprise. They were nice enough to give me a new sausage. I overheard the table behind me that the waiter brought out the wrong item for the gentleman, so they had to do that one over too.

I'm not bashing on the people who work here, but more am wanting to bring to attention that this place really lacks consistency, and honestly, needs a good manager to be on site to help bring this place up to it's full potential.

Even the music in the background was so confusing that I actually noticed how weird it was. I could hear the sound of the tv, and the music playing on the speakers. The weirdest part though was, that the kitchen was playing music that was totally different, and I thought it was inappropriate considering that all the customers could hear it. 

I've been to the other toast location - that one has way better customer service. I hope that Toast ups it's game - it'd be nice if Noe Valley had another solid breakfast stop.
author: Christine L.

description:
This was my fourth and last visit to Toast. I keep coming back thinking maybe they had a bad day, maybe the manager was out, maybe the server had a rough customer right before me...

I had a salad, two eggs, and fruit. My partner had the 2 egg plate with toast and bacon and fruit instead of potatoes (which was included in the price on the menu). 

Total: $43.00 

We looked at the check and saw that they had itemized everything, didn't utilize the combo option, added everything as a side - which inflated our bill probably $10 at least.

We asked one of the employees (busser? expo?) as our waitress was nowhere to be found. He was argumentative and rude but eventually agreed to take off the $2.95 toast.

Add this experience to mediocre, greasy food, forgetting items (a side of toast, asked for hot sauce, coffee or water refill) every time we go... this place needs a revamp. I think I gave it the ol' college try and I won't be back.
author: Tessa M.

description:
When I have omnivorous guests in town I always suggest Toast for breakfast because it's fast, easy, and has vegan options...bam!

The nice thing about Toast is that you can get any of the scrambles with tofu instead. However, I usually find that the tofu scrambles are quite bland and find myself dumping loads of hot sauce on my plate to compensate, though I'm still never completely happy with the scramble at the end. The scrambles come with delicious hash browns that are made with oil (not butter); however, these can be hit or miss as last time mine were overcooked and minuscule. You also get a large serving of toast, which tastes like any other toast. Basic.

At the end of the day, if you want fast, convenient, no-frills breakfast, this is your place. It's a solid option for breakfast and gets the job done.
author: Christina M.

description: Amazing service and amazing food. This will be another one of my weekly spots. I went at 8am and the place was almost empty. Very quiet, perfect place to get ready to start my day.
author: Patricia M.

description:
I would never come back to this place. Probably the worst service I have had in a restaurant in 10 years. The server brought our food or should I say dumped our food on the table and we didn't see it again for 25 minutes. No coffee refills. No water refills. He ignored us as if we were the plague.
Knouff said. Except the food was average at best
author: Paul W.

description:
Everything is good here except the toast. It's sometimes near raw (warm bread), sometimes burnt. Sometimes burnt one side, uncooked on the other. It's never more than lukewarm, which is bad when it's always served dry and the butter comes out of the freezer.

The service is also a bit spotty. Generally good, but sometimes abysmal.

The non-toast menu items are always delicious. I heartily recommend the Joe's scrambler, one of the better Joe's Special versions I've had.

Come, enjoy it for a leisurely meal, but a good one - and hope you get good toast.
author: R H.

description: We stayed in Noe Valley for 4 nights and ate here for breakfast 3 mornings - like we were rolling down to a resort restaurant. Every time we went the food was great and so was the service. Each day we saw something on the menu we wanted to try the next day. Poached eggs were perfect. Pancakes were incredible. Our kids loved it and asked to go back every morning.
author: Thomas H.

description: Quick friendly service and fresh food! I had the combo breakfast and pancakes eggs and bacon were fresh and tasty! But the hash browns were my favorite, they were jus right crispy on both sides and cooled all the way! Hard to get double sided crispy without the overly fried deep fat drenched in most places or cold on one side crispy on the other! Will return for lunch someday!
author: Paul D.

description:
Toast Eatery has a town diner type of feel without the diner prices.

I went on a Saturday morning and there was a decent wait of people. My friend and I put our names down and went to Starbucks to get some coffee. They moved pretty quickly and sat us by the time we got back, we still had our Starbucks with us. One suggestion I have to a lot of those breakfast/brunch places that have a lot of people waiting, you should consider having a coffee station outside or something to convince folks to wait because I'm sure they lose people along the way.

I ordered the Croissant French Toast which is probably heavy in butter and calories but it was pretty good.  I guess some of those melds of breakfast items do work, I still haven't tried a cronut.

I'd probably go again for the Croissant French Toast.
author: Mike L.

description: Not sure about these other reviews!  Pancakes were fluffy with a vanilla flavor and the fruit was fresh. Eggs blackstone was excellent. They poached my eggs to order (medium). Hollandaise had a nice lemon touch. Hash browns were crispy on the outside and yummy. Egg sandwich was well received as well. Waitress was nice and attentive.
author: Rory H.

description:
Toast is a dependable bet for solid food for Breakfast or Lunch. Note that I sent solid and not extraordinary. Toast really reminds me of a traditional New England luncheonette but more modern and with more avocado. The menu has a large selection of omelettes and scrambles as well as traditional breakfast staples like pancakes. For lunch, there are a ton of sandwiches and burgers to choose from as well as a few salads.

Both times that I have come for breakfast, I have gotten omelettes. Both omelettes have been good. The potatoes served with them are fine. Toast is toast. The price is fair for what it is and the portions are big. But again, everything is fine. If you need breakfast and everywhere else has a wait, Toast is a suitable option. If you can get into Griddle Fresh or Chloe's though, you are definitely better off. I have yet to come for lunch so maybe that is their strong suit but who knows.

I will say that they REALLY cram you in at this location. It is so tight that the waiters and waitresses can't get to you easily. We once sat in the back corner and our waitress literally had to pass our food and I never go refills on my coffee even though it was empty before we got our food. I understand this isn't her fault but I really think it would make everyone happier if one or two tables were removed.

TLDR: This place is adequate but don't expect anything past that.
author: Carrie W.

description:
Recommendation: Thinking about going to Toast Eatery? Perhaps you will enjoy it. However, the costs, inconsistent food quality, long lines, unpleasant deep fryer oil flavor, and frequently feeling annoyed at the end of my meal will keep me from retuning or recommending that you eat at any of the Toast locations. I've been a Toast customer probably as long as they have been in San Francisco but I don't recall if there is one owner for all Toast restaurants and since there isn't one single Toast Yelp page, I chose the 24th Street Toast Yelp page to post my review because it is my least favorite Toast location.

Pros & Cons: On the surface, Toast is the kind of place you consider going to for breakfast or lunch because of the convenient locations scattered around the city and a menu that is varied enough for most tastes. But that's where the positive attributes end. The quality of the service and food is widely inconsistent even when I primarily went to the Church Street Toast location for many years. The frequent long wait times for a table (often 30 minutes or more on weekends) and mediocre food is extremely frustrating given the costs (especially the $3.50 ice tea!). Whatever oil they use in the deep fryer has an off-putting flavor that lingers in my mouth long after the meal. It is so bad that I finally stopped ordering fried food even though I loved their fried menu items like the curly fries.

I tried the 24th Street location numerous times and in addition to the extremely loud and chaotic environment, every meal was incorrectly prepared. It is the one location that I have never enjoyed. The Polk Street location was simply unwelcoming. I often felt as though I was somehow imposing on the staff who did little more than mumble through our interactions. In contrast, the staff at the Church Street and West Portal locations are welcoming, kind, and try very hard to accommodate each guest. Both environments are much less chaotic with the exception of the parent patrons who often allow their children to fulfill every impulse like running around unsupervised or play with all of the table condiments, like jellies, throughout their meals without a care for other diners but that is not the fault of the Toast staff who try very hard to respectfully intervene.

Toast was initially a great find but years later, it's just a frustrating waste of money.
author: Thatwasme T.

description:
Sunday morning breakfast and it was raining!  But we got in after a short wait.  This is a diner style restaurant with lots of comfort food.  Yet it is well prepared in that foods was cooked to correct doneness, not a lot of extra grease, and wide selection of for all palates.
The wait staff works very hard, so water glasses and coffee cups stayed filled, and normal times from ordering to receiving food.
I had chicken and waffles, a special that day, and really loved it.  Held me over until dinner, but worth it!
author: Mike A.

description: I'm surprised at the negative reviews here. I've never had a bad experience or bad meal. To me it's a no-frills diner with good food and reasonable prices.
author: Mike L.

description:
I've been here couple times before, and today is probably the worst experience ever. The three of us got in (2 adults, 1 kid), sat at a table for two. The server noticed we have three people, but she only brought us two glasses of water. And no extra set of fork and knife. The worst had yet to come. 

I ordered hamburger steak with eggs, and she brought me eggs/hash brown/toasts, no hamburger steak on the plate. We let our server know, and she took the plate back. Everyone at the table waited another 10 minutes with me for my correct order to arrive. The server informed us my hamburger steak will be taken out of the check. She was right. Only my hamburger steak ($5.50) was taken out of the check. She still charged us $8.25 for my eggs and hash brown that arrived late with my hamburger steak. 

Services at Toast has been alright for being a neighborhood brunch spot, but today's experience makes me never wanna go back again.
author: Yi-Jen L.

description:
After a long morning of doing errands in SF, my roommate and I decided to grab brunch in Noë Valley. We were famished and excited to eat! We ended up coming to Toast Eatery because it had the shortest wait (we were seated pretty much right away) in comparison to the other brunch joints in the area. 

We both ordered egg scrambles. I got the veggie scramble which had assorted vegetables and avocado. It came with a side of hash browns and sourdough bread. 

First, I felt the food was overpriced. The quality and taste of our brunch definitely did not warrant the high cost of our meal. I get that most of the brunch places in the area - and I guess in SF in general - are going to be on the pricier side, but Toast Eatery needs to step up their game to stay competitive. My toast was a little burnt. My hash browns tasted really oily. My eggs were ok but a far cry from special. 

Second, the service was disappointing. After seating us and taking our order, we were basically unattended for the rest of our meal. Additionally, my roommate wasn't provided any cutlery. She had to flag down the waiter and ask for utensils after her food was brought out. 

Because there are a lot of other brunch places in the area, I probably won't be back.
author: Katherine C.

description:
I usually judge breakfast spots by their eggs Benedict and coffee. They had a fair selection of your classic Benedicts, and espresso drinks. I went with the hash Benedict and a regular coffee. 
Not so good: The corned beef was a little too dry, and hollandaise very watery, and with a few onions and peppers thrown around, I'd hardly call it a hash. 
Something good: those hash browns were probably the best I've ever had. 
The portion was adequate but overall this plate was not worth $15. I feel the same way about the coffee, for $3.50 you'd expect something more than just decent.
author: Gabriela M.

description:
Need breakfast at 7? This is your spot. 

The coffee is good, service pretty prompt, and the food is ok ( except for the inedible bacon, but I know there are people who like their bacon over hard.)

Kinda pricey, but I knew it would be and was willing to pay for their 7 am opening time.

Now I'm going back to bed.
author: El B.

description: I've never had an issue here! I come in sit at the bar, the staff is always very quick on their feet. My food always comes out hot! I love my coffee and ice tea, and it is consistently refilled. I would have giving 4 star because I don't understand the charge for syrup. But I'm not going to be petty! Because I still don't have to cook at home, and my food is alway good!!
author: Cory T.

description:
Whenever I'm at Toast, the only thing I can order is the Hash Brown Hill (with a side of bacon). While chilaquiles is probably the closest comparable to breakfast nachos, the hash brown hill is pretty darn close. It's a hill of hash browns (duh) covered with cheese, avocado and sour cream. To add a bit of texture, I order bacon, cut it up and put it over the top - yum! 

Service can be a bit slow. On a Sunday morning, it took a while to get a menu, our food and then our check - it seemed as though they were pretty understaffed. Generally, the wait is a lot shorter than other options on 24th St.

Also, there is a TV so you can keep up with football while you're brunching...
author: Wendy L.

description: The "Must Try" Joe's Scramble is a thumbs down. Straight ground up pink beef with no spices, watery mushroom and spinach scramble. The Smuckers jelly on my toast was good though.
author: James O.

description:
Just ate at Toast Eatery and it has gone down hill.  I now know why there are very few people in there these days, they are all at Griddle Fresh.  The coffee was burnt and tasted disgusting.
I ordered corned beef hash, that was flavorless, with a poched egg, came hard boiled.  They should save themselves rent and close.
author: Sally Z.

description: That was really an undesirable meal.   My coffee cup arrive with old food on the side of it. I got a wet vegetarian burrito and it really had no flavor- the inside was just beans, a little egg and a little cheese. The black beans had zero salt and no flavor. The Ranchero sauce was also very uninspiring. My son had some French toast which was quite tasty. Bacon also looked nice and crispy. it was very hard to get a glass of water and the service was not attentive. I for sure will not return.
author: Pauline C.

description: This is the greatest breakfast place in the city. The cooks are over the top. The quality is crazy good. Amazing service. Every human being working here is a gem. I simply adore this restaurant. Jorge and Jessica just made my morning.
author: Lawrence C.

description: Great simple breakfast spot, went there for brunch on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded. Good portions for the price.
author: David H.

description: The croissant French toast is a must. Go big or go home. Also, the Joe's scramble with turkey hit the spot. Def coming back here for breakfast. :)
author: Alex G.

description: What a nightmare of a place. Specifically ordered my omelette with double chicken sausage and no cheese. Guess what I got ? Very little sausage and smothered in cheese. lol it's not rocket science but obviously it's too much for them to handle. First and last time coming here. Try Sally's next time, at least they won't mess your order up.
author: Alvaro C.

description: I frequently visit in the neighborhood, and this is my go-to spot! They have great food, and the staff is very nice and friendly. Kamal treats his employees with a lot of respect, and he helped in creating such a positive environment. This place is mandatory to go to if you're around the area or if you're visiting from somewhere else.
author: J J.

description:
It was okay...not the best brunch I had, but definitely not the worse either. The hashbrowns were my favorite part of the meal though - crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Most places can't get it right, but I thought Toast did it well. 

As for my breakfast burrito, it was a bit of a letdown. It certainly had a lot of stuff: sour cream, cheese, avocado, eggs, salsa, and your choice of meat (I went with chicken apple sausage), but it wasn't well mixed. It was very mushy on the side with the condiments and cold. Cheese wasn't melted and there also wasn't a lot of meat in my opinion. I did like that the burrito was lightly grilled though,

All in all, food was decent. However, presentation doesn't seem to be a huge thought. Each plate was served up on a GIANT plate, but it was hardly filled. It just made the dish seem skimpy. This was particularly evident for my mom's French Toast which looked like it was just flopped onto the plate. Dusted with powdered sugar, but no other garnish. Very different from the pictures we saw on yelp.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Lousy diner, bad service, bitter coffee, underdone waffle. Pork sausage must have been cooked yesterday then warmed over. Pathetic diner on 24th Street. Had to remind waitress for my coffee. Only two customers in the place, how can you forget to bring one of three items?  I would give negative stars if I could.
author: Barry V.

description:
This is our go-to place for take out breakfast. It's quick, local, fairly priced, and food meets our expectations of what we want from a diner. Quite frankly, I'm not sure what others leaving low reviews purely for the atmosphere are expecting when it's a diner. 

The croissant french toast is always served with fresh berries and bananas (they don't skimp on these either) and the omelets are made well. Their sandwiches haven't been bad either. Our orders are usually packaged up nicely and condiments/utensils provided.

Whenever we don't feel like cooking on the weekend w/out having to wait the typical SF brunch spot waits, we come here. We order via phone amd upon arrival the food is ready to go. And so far we have not been disappointed!
author: Esther A.

description: I was excited to return to this place almost 6 years after a magical experience the first time. Unfortunately, this was not as I remembered it....Sunday morning for brunch line wasn't bad at 10am so we were pretty stoked. We quickly realized why it wasn't that crowded-because they had about 3 people total out on the floor and nobody was paying attention to new diners. Getting coffee and water? Had to flag someone over. Take our order? Flag someone over. Silverware for our food? Splenda? Refills? You guessed it, had to flag someone down EVERY. TIME. Clearly could have used more people to provide better service but overall food was good not great, definitively not as good as I remembered. Another irritation -EVERRRYYYTHING is additional charges! Egg whites, real maple syrup, fruit instead of potatoes....all additional  $2.50+ which can add up if you don't pay attention. Overall meh.
author: Amy P.

description:
Absolutely loved this place !!! And to a huge surprise so did my man he usually hates eating out for breakfast cuz he says a lot of places make there food bland but toast eatery was far from bland.. It was BOMB! 

Anyways my moms first time to SF and she loved the little diner ! We all cleaned our plates!! I will recommend this to anyone it's so good !! Oh and it's small so it gets crowded fast but Totally worth the wait!!
author: Cam V.

description: Probably my favorite neighborhood spot for a breakfast bagel. Good service and convenient location. Good size as well so if you're going with a group, not a bad option.
author: Justin Y.

description: Average at best but definitely pricey.  Very good Americano however.  Price versus serving size doesn't warrant a return.
author: Joel M.

description: I've been the biggest corn and beef hash fan everywhere I go. This place absolutely nailed it, might want to get there early as this place gets packed real quick. definitely worth the wait!
author: Ian E.

description:
I frequently come to toast with my family and generally receive very good service but today was an eye opener with the very negative service me and my group of 5 received. 

When they called our name the guy rudely asked where the rest of our group is at and they have to seat somebody else if they were not here right now. My cousin told him that the rest of our group was looking for parking and would be here in a few minutes which they did. So when we sat we immediately ordered 4 coffees, 2 orange juices and 5 waters and waited for the rest of our group to come patiently. When we finally ordered their was an impression that the waitress was upset was us so my cousin asked if they were upset with us. She immediately became defensive and said that she was not upset but that their was frustration because other tables couldn't get served because of our entire group not being there on the spot (even though it was only 5 minutes). That made us extremely uncomfortable and my cousin just said we understand to try and ease the tension. Mind you all 5 of us each ordered an entrée and the bill came out to 73 dollars. 

So when our food finally came after 20 minutes and during that time we can overhear some of the cooks looking in our direction and talking about us. The waitress didn't really talk to us until we were paying the bill. So when we paid our 73 dollar bill she "apologized" about her attitude. the apology didn't really matter because it was too late and it seemed to us she was only apologizing just to try and get a tip. 

The overall experience today was very bad. Their was negative energy, bad attitude and just a lack of professionalism in this establishment. We were very patient and polite so the service we were getting back was terrible. We gave a 25 dollar tip to send a message that despite the bad service, bad attitude and a clear attempt to get a tip we will still show politeness and professionalism when the servers can't do that.
author: Mohammad A.

description:
Croissant toast with vanilla/cinnamon really yummy!
Chicken pesto sandwich- really moist chicken!
Heat Burger with brioche bun was really really good!
Definitely coming back when I'm in Noey Valley
author: Florita A.

description: I originally gave a 5 star review and this used to be the place I always took my friends for brunch. However the last few times I got food here, my food was super mediocre. I'd still eat here again if it was convenient, the food is still okay breakfast diner food. But I don't think I'd go out of my way to eat here when there are so many other great breakfast spots in the city. The meals aren't original and a lot of the veggies either taste close to the end of shelf life or canned - I'm not sure what it is really but they don't taste fresh.
author: Bryce B.

description:
I wouldn't go back here for 2 reasons: 

1. The attitude from one of the waitresses sucked. I get that it's Sunday and they're busy but when you call us in from waiting outside for 20mins don't just walk away and carry on doing what you were doing before and make us guess that the empty table at the back is our seat. How hard is it to smile & show someone to their seats? The other waitress who actually served us though was really helpful though so I guess the older lady was having a bad day. 
2. The food was over cooked. I ordered the Hash Benedict. Eggs were over cooked so the yolks were not runny at all, the muffin was burnt and the hash brown was bland. The hash brown could definitely do with some seasoning.
author: Kelly M.

description:
As luck would have it, Muni was running late, making me totally miss my yoga class. I should've been pissed but decided what the heck!  When life doesn't work out the way you want it to -- you don't spend the time getting mad -- you spend it stuffing your face instead. (I'm either optimistic or efficient with my time. You decide)

I ordered the corned beef hash: stringy meat interspersed with soft potatoes and onions.  It came with crispy hash brown, over easy eggs and big slices of whole grain bread. I love the generous servings here and for less than $10, that's a good price for San Francisco.  My Earl grey tea was refilled with hot water without my having to ask. 

Try to grab a seat by the window for maximum people watching. You wouldn't wanna miss eyeing that cute single dad walking his dog on 24th st.  ;-)
author: Janice C.

description:
Just got delivery through post mates. The French fries that came with my fish and chips were gross and soggy likely due to the fact they packed the fries and hot fish in with a I can only assume was cold salad vs. The wilted nasty pile in the corner of the box. The fish was the only decent thing in the box but the "tater sauce was bland and mildly oily. So far the only redeeming factor has been the Mac and cheese.  
      I strongly recommend the owner teach his staff how to properly box to go food a salad should never be put in the same container as hot fries or any hot food for that matter. And line checks cause the tarter sauce tastes like mildly chunky mayo bland.
author: Kristen H.

description:
On a cold and rainy and dreary day, I found myself exploring 24th Street in Noe Valley. I was not necessarily in search of lunch, but knew I'd need it eventually. So many options in this area, but with the help of Yelp's reviews, I chose Toast. (Plus the atmosphere looked inviting when I walked by the first time.) 

Was the omelette blow your mind spectacular? No. But seriously, you can't ask too much of an omelette or scramble in the first place. It's about the ingredients and the preparation and I am happy to say Toast hit the mark. I went with the Church Street omelette and it was literally bursting with the avocado, bacon, onions and spinach. Every cut I made of the omelette resulted in the piled-up ingredients falling out. I loved this. There was no skimping on the filling and it made for a delicious omelette. I opted for a salad instead of hash browns and this too was a plentiful portion.

I sat at the counter and was taken care of efficiently but without any hovering. If in the neighborhood again, I'll happily stop in.
author: David B.

description: Pretty damn good.  They have buckwheat pancakes which are seriously delicious and the omelets rock.  It is a cute environment and usually not too long of a wait.  I could do brunch here more often.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Honestly, I love food. I rarely ask for anything on the side or any substitutions  (i.e. I'm easy). The 2 stars is for the OJ, the cute sign out front, and service.

Came here with the kids and husband and ordered the eggs Benedict, a breakfast sandwich, and waffles. I can't tell you which was worse. I couldn't even eat any of it. Luckily, the kids will eat anything drenched in maple syrup. So at least the waffle were eaten. My husband did manage to eat most of the sandwich too.

Disappointing start to our food tour of SF
author: CC P.

description: This place has gone way downhill. What is with established eateries that cannot maintain a level of consistency over time? Poor service (even when slow) and crap food. Cold hashbrowns, slimy hash,  burnt English muffins, cheap lunchmeat on a Cobb salad with wilted lettuce,  not to mention lip marks on 'fresh' glass. When management gets lazy and fails to keep up the standard anyone would come to expect when forking over cash for a meal one could make better at home, business will, inevitably, sour. Have some damn pride already!
author: Liz F.

description:
One of the better brunch places I've tried in the city. A less pretentious restaurant, this place is perfect for Saturday/ Sunday morning brunch without the ridiculous wait times  of most other brunch place in the city.

Some quick tips,
-Try the hash browns here, they are amazing. 
-The wait is shorter, but is still there.  However, there is a Starbucks next door so at least you can get your coffee fix in in the meanwhile.
-this place needs higher reviews!
author: Patricia K.

description: The service was amazing! The food?! Even better. Thank you Kelli for helping us out today and for being kind enough to make sure we were well taken care of. The most AMAZING mac & cheese.
author: Tamara R.

description: Our breakfast dishes were the quality of a Denny's with the prices of an upscale diner.  Our waffle was flat and chewy, the burgers had no seasoning, and the bacon was like a dry crunchy salt lick.  We went on a hot day and the door was propped open so flies were having a field day hovering over kitchen area.  Other eateries along the street have longer lines and its for good reason.
author: David S.

description:
My first time there this morning for breakfast and was unimpressed 
I ordered the salmon Benedict - the lox and the tomato were so cold they ruined the Benedict - I don't usually find my self overly sensitive to food temperature  but this was no good :(
author: Leda M.

description: If you're going to pay SF brunch prices you can at least go somewhere else where the food isn't utterly mediocre. That may even be generous. We had the Joe's scramble, chocolate chip pancakes, and corned beef hash. Somehow coffee is $3.25. I wish I had trusted the existing reviews.
author: Natalie S.

description:
Hash brown hill is a must try! I got it with the avocado, sour cream and onions on the side with just the cheese on top. Delicious! 

Corn beef hash was tasty as was the croissant French toast. Price is right and maybe even cheaper for Noe Valley. The only reason for 3 stars is the service. They had many open tables but were extremely short staffed. That meant there were groups of people on the wait list, just hanging around outside. At one point, people just went in and grabbed their own seats. Two servers in the whole restaurant for a Saturday breakfast rush is just not enough. But I'd definitely come back and try again!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I came here for lunch before swinging by a local bakery. 

I arrived around 1:15 right before another lunch rush. I only had to wait a few minutes to be seated. YAY! 

I ordered the grilled salmon sandwich. The salad wasn't bad. Considering it's a salad, I hope you don't screw that up. My salad was dressed in vinaigrette. My main entree salmon sandwich on ciabatta bread it was a bit on the bland side. And it was a bit oily on the bottom side. No, it is not because of the salad dressing, the bread is just greasy at the bottom. This sandwich does not live up to my favorite at Nordie's Cafe. 

I think the next time I come back, I am going to skip the sandwiches and head straight for some breakfast. I'll be back.
author: Jess W.

description:
Brunch was pretty blend, one of the "poached" egg was almost hardboiled, overall food was tasteless , the ham felt like spam, the hash brown was undercooked, so I guess it doesn't qualify as "brown" , orange juice was pretty good but for the price you might expect fresh pressed one. 
Making a little effort of corrects seasoning and presentation would not hurt, maybe a few salad leaves with the eggs, it cost nothing, oh, wait, yes like 5 cents or something.. but I guess most people goes there when Savor or griddle fresh are packed...anyway, next time I'll go to Starbucks next door, at least I'll know what to expect!
author: Gregoire V.

description:
Love!

Been here twice and never disappointed. Great at handling large groups, the service was on point and friendly, the food was hangover friendly and just delicious in general and the mimosas were perfect. Had the Benedict and the eggs were poached to perfection and the has browns were exactly how hash browns should be, a little greasy and anything but healthy. 

Reasonable prices and cute decor. If you are looking a just a good basic brunch, nothing fancy or special then this is the place. 

Warning - beer and wine license only. I got excited to have a Bloody Mary until I read it was made with Soju. Just a minor set back so I opted for a mimosa.
author: Lindsey M.

description: The ratings are pretty accurate.  It's a typical diner with standard eggs and bacon.  Nothing special. Service was nice and they have mimosas.
author: Diana D.

description: Just finishing up my lox and English muffin, made by our boy Louis ! Damn this man makes the presentation look so good , you ALMOST don't want to eat it!! Kudos to you Louis , keep up the great work!! Speaking of great work, Irina our waitress was just a rockin' too!!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Meh.  In short...

Like:
- I like the Sirron Norris art.  Vibe is easy and laid back.
- Staff were nice.
- Some of their foods are organic (?)

Not jiving:
- Burned coffee, runny egg scramble with mealy tomatoes, mushy mealy hash browns @~11 / plate.  I'm not a foodie, but even I was unimpressed.  Too expensive for a Denny's quality meal.  You have to be a little more competitive in SF's food industry.

For brunch, reroute to Savor down the street.
author: Elle T.

description: The quality of the food and service is terrible.  toast was cold eggs uncooked.  Don't ever go there way over priced
author: Kelli F.

description:
Decent. 

This place doesn't have long saturday and sunday morning lines. Thats good and bad - the food will not wow you, but you won't have to wait forever. Its a good option if you're looking to get things done. 

Service and price are alright.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great brunch spot, ordered the challah French toast and the Nutella waffles. Very delicious, service was good. A little right in the seating, but a definite spot to try while in Noe Valley!
author: Tiffany G.

description:
Incredible how bad the service is.

Waitress sat a couple and then asked them to move.  Worst part is she ... gets in a loud argument with the couple.

She then goes over to her colleague behind the counter (another waitress) and makes comments ... they both then begin laughing.

Really?  This is how to welcome customers.  Wow!

I'm sitting at the counter feeling bad for the couple.
author: J B.

description:
Nice place! Wanted to get brunch in The City, and passed by this restaurant and thought we'd give it a try. Once you walk in, you feel a calm ambiance. It's a feel you get where you would think, "Hey, this is a perfect place to cure my hangover". The menu has a plethora of option and there's something for everyone. Their prices were average and their portions were a good size. 

Decor: Nice view, and Diner-style feel (well it is a diner so duh), Very bright inside, very relaxing.

Service: When we walked in, the hostess said we could choose anywhere we would like to sit, which was a major plus. Menus were placed at every table so there was no need to wait for them. Very friendly service and our food only took about 10-15 minutes to come out, and we were STARVING so that was good.

Food: My Girlfriend ordered the California Burger, medium rare with bacon and garlic fries. I ordered the French Dip with a side of Garlic fries as well.
Cali Burger: Cooked to perfection! It actually doesn't come with bacon, but if you add bacon it's the perfect combo. It's still delicious without it, but for you bacon lovers, it's great. The patty was tender and juicy and the cheese was soft and chewy. The avocados were super fresh and if blended nicely with the burger. The garlic fries were OK, she wasn't too impressed with them and neither was I, so I would personally opt for the regular fries (They were also a dollar extra).
The French Dip: Very heavy, but enjoyable. The sauce was a bit too salty for my liking, but the roast beef was pretty good, as was the bread (it was very chewy). Cheese was not melted all the way which sucked, but once dipped in the sauce, I forgot about that.

Would definitely come back if in the area, but wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Tip: Garlic fries will leave you with garlic breath the ENTIRE day so beware and prepare!!!
author: Brian Y.

description:
I walked by this place and was attracted to its cute name and cute toast related decorations. There were cute cartoons drawn on huge toast looking pieces of artwork. They were so cute and whimsicaI. There was also a sense of neighborhood warmness because the artwork incoorporated many iconic noe valley images. I really enjoyed the fun artwork at this place. 

However, the food was ok. 

I ordered an eggs benedict breakfast. The hash was thin and super oily and too salty. The poached egg was great, but the hollandise sauce was bland. The whole eggs benedict was pretty bland except for the canadian bacon.

The place was cute, but the food was only ok. I would recommend their chocolate milk shake. It was light and airy. And had a malt flavor to it. It was different from other heavy shakes and worth trying if you so happen to be in the neighborhood.
author: Janice T.

description: Bad experience today. The staff kept opening the door even after I closed it. So not only was it cold outside, it was also cold inside. Formerly one of my favorite places. We got our coffee with our food as tables around us who sat down after us already had theirs. The coffee was disgusting it was so strong. We poured water into our cups to drink it. They were quick to give us our bill though. They need to improve the quality of their staff.
author: David H.

description:
I love waking up a little late and venturing out in search of a very satisfying brunch. It takes a special kind of place to tempt me out of my sleep, into my clothes and out the door, only to wait on the cold sidewalk for almost 20-30 minutes to have some brunch. 

Oh Toast, you are that special kind of place. Part of me loves you because your art pays homage to the former "Herb's Fine Foods" that used to stand in your place. My grandpa would bring me here for strawberry waffles and as much coffee as I could get away with drinking before someone said something about a kid drinking coffee.

I brought the *crush* here recently. I'm always trying to introduce him to new places that have great food. He ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and I ordered the very impressive Eggs Florentine (Spinach, Tomato and Avocado) and added bacon to it. It's a nice thick cut hearty bacon, yummy. 

It was obvious that I picked the winner, so I decided to share my breakfast with him, which worked out perfectly. I hope he realizes how lucky he is, I don't just share my food with everyone. Hahaha!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
TOAST is a no go. Miss Herbs, at least you paid dinner prices for their food. Toast has single handedly killed quality in Noe Valley. Granted, since Joe's left, there is a void for decent breakfast food, but for my buck I would go to Savor.
Food: awful- gotten frozen hash browns multiple times. I've given them multiple chances, but just can't do it. Beef cheesesteak is ok, but good luck getting it... Waiter has brought me the chicken cheesesteak twice. Leading to...
Service: bad, but not because they're bad people. Everyone is nice, no mean spirited people here. Just get orders wrong, forget to come back, questionable cooking anyone????
I will not be going back.
author: zach B.

description: I am a fan of the Toast on Church St, but today, instead, I went to the Toast on 24th. Worst Pancakes Ever.  They were raw in the middle.  I almost never send food back, but I sent these pancakes back. The 2nd batch were cooked through, but had absolutely no cake-ness.  The were solid and rubbery, like super-thick crepes.  Chefs make mistakes.  But when a customer sends food back, there is no excuse for replacing it with food that is still obviously not right.
author: Paul F.

description: 3.25 dollars for a cup of coffee? I mean I'm no cheap stake but there is a Starbucks next door. If I wanted overpriced coffee I would have gone there. Also.. Not a fan of the cheese slices they use to top the scramblers. It makes your dishes look cheap and it's not pleasant to look at. The only good thing about my experience here was the service. For a neighborhood like Noe Valley this restaurant is definitely not up to standard.
author: Mauricio M.

description: What a rip offf.  This place just charged $28 for an omelette with two extra eggs.  I've eaten here a few times but this crazy.   There are better alternatives in the area. And the staff acknowledged the over charge but wouldn't change it
author: Rob E.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Toast Eatery on Church. This one, not so much... And not for lack of trying. They have the same menu but the food is not consistent. It tastes completely different than the church location and the items I order regularly are never cooked the same way. That may be an issue of different cooks but still.

I got the salmon Benedict with corned beef hash tonight. The eggs were hard boiled.. Poached but hard boiled.. And there was an eggshell in my food. The corned beef hash was tasty but really overcooked and chewy..

These are small details that can be easily fixed but it feels like the cook doesn't care or like their job. Shame.
author: Roxane F.

description: Love this place! I have always had good service, even on the busy weekends. During the week its pretty quiet in here and a nice place for a relaxing breakfast. On the weekends expect it to be pretty packed and there to probably be a wait for a table. But for a simple tasty American style breakfast at a reasonable cost I don't think this place can be beat.
author: Mark L.

description: I come to Toast maybe 2-3 times a month and  great experiences but today was a bit different in terms of service. We had a group of 5 and one of the guys that works there told my cousin we need the whole group here I then walked up to him and told him the group is on their way we sat down ordered 4 coffees 2 orange juice and it took awhile for for the rest to come due to lack of parking in Noe Valley District. We sat uncomfortably but did not complain so when we were all seated waitress came to me with a bit of an attitude I saw that right away and told her if she was upset she would NOT look at my direction was immediately defensive about not being upset spite her facial expression towards my table. Of course I was polite but I told her i understood and went about it. It ruined our morning breakfast knowing there was an issue and the guy was complaining about us to his friends and waitress did not seem to care about us even though we spent $74.00  plus a $25.00 tip. I understand getting a table at Toast is very frustrating at time but when there is 4 tables that is vacant there should be no problem sitting the rest of the group that have been waiting patiently outside. She then came to apologize afterwards about her attitude towards our table i found it highly rude she would wait till we left!!!! We have a family business store so we understand customer service is main priority at the end of it we had NO customer service at all!!!! JUST SAD!!
author: Ahmad O.

description:
What an amazing brunch spot! 

My girlfriend that was visiting from NYC and I randomly found this place on Saturday, as we were strolling down 24th street. We looked at the menu and it has many different options, from breakfast to lunch. 

We were seated immediately and from the very second that we sat down, till the second we left, the service was simply amazing. The waiters were extremely attentive and nice. What really made me like this place is that the owner of the restaurant was there the entire time, and ran around doing pretty much everything! He was absolutely great and you can tell that he takes so much pride in his establishment. 

I ordered the salmon Benedict (asked for capers on the side) and my friend has their burger with fries. Everything was SO GOOD and tasty! 

I will definitely be back! Keep up the great work, guys!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
A solid Noe Valley diner. I've had nothing but good experiences here, with the only caveat being the price. It is expensive for a diner but then again it is in the heart of Noe Valley and is appropriate for the neighborhood and clientele.

I occasionally enjoy eating at the counter when dining alone and the service is always fast and friendly. The coffee is good, and they are fast on refills.

My favorite breakfast item is the Chicken Fried Steak with White Gravy and Fried Eggs. It is quite a large meal and I typically eat half and take the rest with me. I've had the same dish at Alice's restaurant and it was way better here.

Their menu is extensive and has both breakfast lunch and dinner items. If you need a solid breakfast in Noe valley, it's generic but it's decent. If you're only 2 people the wait has never been more than 10-15 minutes.
author: Jordan C.

description:
Diner food in Noe Valley...FINALLY!!  Well, I grew up there and don't remember any place serving diner food, so it was a pleasant surprise to find Toast Eatery on 24th Street the other day.  The place, I believe, is fairly new...maybe only a year or two old.  I could be wrong.  Either way, it still looks pretty clean inside.  They have some cool artwork hanging on the walls and I appreciated that they had a TV as well. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=kPG7GQi1OdpQ7Ehgge9EoA)

Even though it was lunchtime, I'm a sucker for breakfast food and was craving some eggs.  So I went with the "24th street" omelet.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=pYJIIa2lU_6NuxK7N5KFUw)  It was made with chicken apple sausage, spinach, sun dried tomato, and feta.  It was pretty good.  All the ingredients had a distinct taste but still went well with each other.  The omelet also came with some pretty decent hash browns and my choice of bread.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=y9d8n_ZcRMpab4heJv9-pw)

Pricing is average, about $10 a pop.  Service was attentive and the food came out fast.  The menu is extensive enough that you can come back several times and still have plenty of options.  They serve eggs, pancakes, french toast, waffles, salads, burgers, and sandwiches.  I definitely plan on coming back to try other items.  Yay for more diverse selections on 24th Street!!!
author: Joe M.

description: Stopped off for lunch today late in the afternoon the food took over 20 minutes to come out and the service was awful ... I had to ask every time I wanted a refill on a cup of coffee ... I've been to the toast on portola a totally different experience ... My advise stay away from the one on 24 th street toast if you want your meal on time and good service
author: Joey C.

description:
I love toast. So any place called Toast Eatery is going to eventually get me in for a visit!!!

True to their word, I got a lot of toast with my scramble. Four slices, in fact. I could only manage one slice but took home the rest. My Noe Valley scramble was good, but the real star of the show was the hash browns. They were incredible! Perfectly flavored and cooked. I'd have been delighted with a whole meal that was just a huge vat of those hash browns.

I'd have given Toast Eatery four stars, but I give it three because our service was a little slow and inattentive. I was trying to order a dessert, but the server didn't notice or ask and just gave us a bill. I ended up having to pay twice... a little annoying. I'd still come back and just get a huge order of hash browns and coffee on some greasy, indulgent morning!
author: Denise B.

description:
The wait staff is nice.
The food is good. 
The hash browns are really good (which is a miracle because I hate hash browns)
The only down side is that my delicious apple sausage, bacon, mushroom and egg scramble came with the saddest pieces of toast ever. 
The bread was good quality but it wasnt TOASTED correctly!
I don't know about you but I like my breakfast without irony.
Overall it was a good meal but they really need to work on their toasting skills:)
author: Stephanie S.

description:
TURKEY BOCA BURGER - trust me
(4 stars)

Who stuffs their face like that?!?!?!?! I'm not a "burger" type of person AT ALL... but damn....

- Food, good but depends what you get
- Prices, fair
- Service, on-point
- Ambiance, modern diner style

Dinner plans failed and plan B was in affect. Hate it when friends bug you to leave you busy work life to have dinner. For 4 days checking in everyday to make sure I am still able to make dinner plans. And then 1hr before meet-up, FLAKES. Supressed my hunger all day hoping to have a FAT night with a friend and have homegirl talks. Whatever, so decided to go to Noe Valley and check out the live reindeers. Saw Toast  Eatry was open and always wanted to have breakfast here and said WHAT THE HELL, GO STUFF YOUR FACE. I need comfort food.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

TURKEY BOCA BURGER california style ($10.80) - forget the breakfast items why not go off the walls and try something unexpected. I barely ever eat burgers, so said what the hell do it. Thank you friend for flaking on our dinner plans because THIS WAS THE BEST TURKEY BOCA i've ever put in my hugry mouth. My Turkey Burger was california style so it had avocado and swiss cheese. The patty was SO juicy and tender. This item just suprised my palate, it was THAT good. I scarfed that sucka down like there aint no tomorrow. Screw my strict eatings, cardio, and my daily 100 sit-ups tonight. All worth it!

Will I be back? For breakfast one day... but definately for that Turkey Boca Burger.

Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: yummy little bfast spot - quiet too so you can have a conversation with people
author: Mark K.

description: Worst tofu scramble ever. Completely bland, unseasoned, barely cooked, enormous squares of tofu hardly constitutes a "scramble". Paired with flavorless veggies, it was barely edible. Great hash browns though, and the toast would have been fine if there had been a vegan option to put on it (came with pats of butter, even though we'd asked specifically about making everything vegan). Ok Bloody Mary, but nothing special. Everything was basically flavorless.
author: Erica M.

description:
Upgrading my rating to 3 and would love to make it a 4-star review if the recent improvements are permanent. There is new staff in the kitchen and new servers, and things have gotten much much better both in terms of consistency of the food and service quality. 

Prior outdated review is below:

There are three other much better breakfast locations in Noe, but unfortunately Toast opens an hour earlier so has a monopoly on the 7-8am crowd.

Their new server (guy there since last summer when Meagan left) makes errors in our order almost every single week; he just doesn't listen.  God forbid you order tea - you can absolutely forget about anyone offering you more hot water for the duration of your breakfast. For that matter, you have to flag down the staff for just about everything you need, including the check.

The style of food prep varies occasionally, which isn't a big deal unless you - like me - draw the line at what actual ingredients end up on your plate.  Maybe they thought it was 'bonus flavor' to cook my breakfast on bacon grease one day, but since I haven't eaten meat in 20 years, I really can't digest it anymore and was left with stomach cramps and nausea for about 3 hours.  Try at least wiping off the griddle between customers?  Definitely NOT recommended for anyone with food allergies!!

If only Savor, LeZinc or Griddle Fresh opened earlier..
author: Lester N.

description: This review for the Toast French Toast (haha). Pretty tasty, I must say. I was a meh fan of the location on Polk Street near my hood, but liked the diner feel of this location a bit better. The challah french toast in particular was really good--worth the trip alone and under $8, pretty reasonable.
author: Mel G.

description:
Had a great brunch here this morning. This place is pretty small but they were VERY accomdating for our rather large party (8 people). Had the veggie scramble and added bacon. The order somehow got served to me wrong but they fixed the problem pretty quickly. Scramble was on point and full of yummy veggies. Wish there had been more avocado and less mushrooms though! LOVED the hash browns too. Crispy, greasy, and left me satisfied.

Overall this place is no frills, simple but good food. Their mimosas were generous with the champagne as well! If you are in the Noe area and hungover on a Sunday there is no better place I can think of to go to !
author: Brandon H.

description: ...Excellent breakfast for 2 = $40...Noe Valley Yuppie Town's best breakfast...
author: jim b.

description:
Very nice place, efficient and sweet waitress. Perfect menu for breakfast or brunch. And the order come fast at your table. Highly recommended.

Try the hashbrowns.
author: Jean Louis B.

description:
The staff here is super friendly and its a nice and rather average diner.  But really, I can scramble my own eggs and make my own toast most days of the week.  The food is always decent, but doesn't really excite me.  This is the problem of trying to make a 'nice diner'.  

You see, its way too clean in here to be a divy place to get eggs and coffee.  And the prices are way to high for them to give me eggs and toast in an english muffin.  Go to Joe's for a better breakfast sans wait.
author: David S.

description:
Meh kind of sums up my experience. Lots of sitting around and waiting. My toast came out of a bag, and I think they forgot salt in my dish. I wanted to try this place because it reminded me of Friendly Toast back in Cambridge, but this was neither kitschy cute nor tasty. Not worth the price for something I could easily whip up at home.

The secretly sinister coffee charging thing didn't happen to us though. My bf's coffee was refilled for free.
author: Christine H.

description:
I can't believe this only has three stars.  That's fine, though.  I'll just keep this place all to myself.  You can stay away.

Here's the thing - it's a diner, people.  It's not some trendy fusion place.  It makes comfort food, and it does an excellent job at it.  Prices aren't too high.  The sandwiches are really good.  It can have a line, but I've never seen it be more than fifteen minutes.  Then again, I avoid it during family hours.

Toast is on my short list of local places I frequent.  It's a great little diner, and one of the few places in the area where the food justifies the price.
author: Brian L.

description:
Three of us had a good breakfast at Toast - mid week around 10 am and no wait!

Hash browns are exceptionally crispy and good and my egg white Mission omelet was really good....my plate in my picture shows the plentiful portion along with good sour dough toast.

Service was very good, not exceptional and our coffee cups were kept full.

I'd return but if there's a long wait I will probably move on.
author: Randall F.

description: Waiter brought the wrong order to my friend, and after 5 minutes of waiting for new actual order he tells her they're out of the bun she needs for her french dip. Food was also meh.
author: Samantha C.

description:
During the busy brunch rush this weekend, I decided to go here for the second, and probably last, time.  I ordered an overcooked "fish n chips" and despite the name of the menu item, they were incredibly skimpy on the "chips".  

The main reason for the low rating is because of the service, or lack thereof.  We patiently waited till our name was only one of two, but after standing inside for at least 5 minutes grew irritated.  Not only did several servers walk past us as if we weren't there, but we watched as 4 tables opened up just waiting to be used.  We finally walked over to a table and asked if we could sit down.  Once finally being seated, it took quite a while to even be visited by our waitress let alone get some water glasses.  She barely spoke any words to us, didn't smile or ask how we were doing at any point - she never even made eye contact with us.  My impression was that they just didn't care.
author: Jamie G.

description:
Ate here after having just moved from Chicago to Noe Valley, and decided to bring my parents here as their first California Brunch spot for their visit. absolutely loved it! Decently priced, great vibe, love the artwork and the wait staff were super welcoming and accommodating.
I specifically enjoyed the option to replace the side toast with a salad- was not expecting that considering the name of the place haha. Seriously made my paleo boyfriends day!
I ordered the "toast" scrambler. Super tasty! Didn't need even a pinch on salt or hott sauce/etc. mom ordered the veggie omelet and loved it. Dad the classic Denver. 
I did find the coffee to be a bit overpriced at $3 a pop for just your basic black.. But I over looked this on the stars since I did enjoy it so much and happily made do by mooching on my moms coffee to make up for the price.
Will gladly and definitely return :D
author: Diana M.

description:
It was a really nice Sunday brunch I had here. Long line but I was cool. good eggs Benedict!
I liked the ambiance as well. Not a greasy spoon but a breakfast join!
author: Lizzy M.

description:
While you're waiting for a table for brunch, you could make a game out of guessing how many strollers/babies/dogs you see walking past. We even saw a stroller with two babies! No, it wasn't a double stroller - one kid was in the seat, and the other was bundled up in the storage bin underneath. Who knew stroller space would be as scarce as SF real estate?

After waiting about 45 minutes for a table of four, my friends and I finally got seated (we lost count of the number of strollers/babies/dogs). My friend and I shared a TOAST COMBO (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=sQ3j-_JMC12bzVgLs1oKrw) and an order of croissant French toast. The pancakes and hashbrowns from the combo were decent (but anything smothered with syrup and ketchup, respectively, is good in my books) and I really liked the chicken apple sausage.

I had high hopes for the CROISSANT FRENCH TOAST (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=M7eudIHtBgzFuxUYQeGDgQ) but it was a  major disappointment. The math doesn't quite add up. This is what I mean:

Croissants = good
French toast = good
And yet, Croissants * French toast = meh

Theoretically, croissant French toast should be double the goodness of the individual components. In reality, all the things I love about croissants (flakiness, buttery-ness, fluffy-ness, airy-ness) gets lost in French toast form. Instead, I was left with extra-greasy French toast :(

I had a bite of my friend's BELGIAN WAFFLES WITH NUTELLA & STRAWBERRIES (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Hyjorx4CzbEJGEjaUzenng?select=aP92-9ez-0ism6Lhu9VX7Q) and that was scrumptious! But then again, I feel the same way about melted nutella as I do syrup and ketchup...

Toast is a good enough place for brunch (decent menu and average food), but not a place I would wait in line for.
author: Steph L.

description:
This place delivered exactly what I was looking for. Nothing fancy, just tasty, fast, comforting breakfast food. 
I got a veggie omelette with cheddar, mushrooms, avocado, bacon, onion and tomato. It was delicious. The only problem was that there was too much bacon. Never thought I would say that, but it kind of got in the way of the rest of the omelette. 
The coffee was bad. I did not like it at all. 
The toast was actually quite good. 
The hash browns were kind of the star. They were crispy and salty and perfect. 
This place delivers exactly what it claims, which is solid breakfast. I will be back.
author: Cami J.

description: Good breakfast and great service. The order came fast. The server was attentive and check on everyone
author: Sharon S.

description: This place is okay. My boyfreind and I come here sometimes as a back up when Griddle is a few shops down is full. We prefer the Toast location on Church street, the food tasts better there... maybe it's the different cooks. Also the seating is better, especially ouside but they don't make milkshakes at the location on Church which is a bummer. The vanilla expresso shake they make here is AMAZING! Coffee is pretty too. But it's very noisy inside and hard to have a conversation, even when the person you are with is sitting directly infront of you...
author: Genevieve N.

description:
I love Toast Eatery's burgers, French toast topped with mixed fruits, salmon sandwich with salad,  fries, vanilla milk shake, root beer float and their coffee. i come here often and they always serve high quality food. 

for breakfast over the weekend, this place is always my top choice to eat.  last time my wife ordered a joe's scrambler, and she loved it!!!  my kids love their kid's size chocolate chip pancakes.  and me, i really love their coffee, strong and bold.

this is a very comfortable small place to eat in a nice neighborhood.  if you come on the weekend, you would have to wait in line.  if you come on the weekdays during lunch time or in the evening, it is very peaceful, relaxing.   the food come quick - always fresh and hot. the fruits are always fresh and sweet, especially their blue berry and strawberries.  

the service is good.  the servers are friendly and efficient. 

i love this place for 1 simple reason:  their food is good. i highly recommend this place for anyone here to eat.
author: Kentaro K.

description:
I was wrong about Toast improving its food quality as they grew into the space.  Toast is not upgrading.  It revels in its inner blandness. 

The place is always crowded.  They have found their niche.  But, the Toast-ettes appear to all be white-bread white people from the mid-West where "spice" is a four-letter word.

Everything on the menu is something that I cook myself (okay, I don't cook red meat, but I could fry bacon the simple way Toast does).  Except when I cook it tastes better.

I have cultured friends who rave about Toast.  I just don't understand.
author: Galen W.

description:
What I like best about this place is breakfast served all day --including Egg's Benedict, which not many restaurants would actually do.  I was here on a Saturday around 7PM and the place was pretty empty.  It's a boring place to eat, not much of a scene or ambiance --it's simple and uber casual.  The servers here are accommodating and friendly and that's really all that there is to it.  

I ordered the Egg's Benedict and it is just alright here.  I didn't like their hollandaise sauce, which is an essential part to a good Egg's Benedict. The hash browns are a bit on the oily side but was still pretty good with a crispy outer layer.
author: Brenda T.

description:
If you're craving Toast Eatery, I would stay far away from this one. The one on Church street has MUCH better food & service. This one has the snobby "I'm rich so I'm better than you" Noe Valley attitude. The employees and patrons here are always super snooty and impolite. 
Don't say you close at 10 and close at 9/9:30pm...unprofessional and lazy.
author: William M.

description: I came in today for a brunch and was greeted with smiling faces. The waitress that helped me was very helpful and immediately offered me something to drink. After a few minutes, I decided to try the Eggs Benedict. The plate came out in about 15 minutes. So, the wait wasn't too long. The food was definitely worth the wait. The hollandaise sauce was amazing and the eggs were cooked just right. I'll definitely be back. :)
author: Joshua M.

description: Sunday brunch is soo good! Too many delicious choices, but I settled on the Noe Valley scramble: eggs with turkey bacon, onions, creamy green avocado. Hash browns were golden brown, crispy outside, soft potato goodness inside.  The toast at Toast (!) comes in wheat (good bread) and other choices. Friendly server who kept the full-bodied coffee cups hot and full. Will return over & over again!
author: René T.

description: I love breakfast places, and this eatery did not disappoint! I came for dinner, so it wasn't that busy. The waitress was attentive and friendly. The food portions are pretty big, too. I had the hash brown hill, and it was really delicious!
author: Rachel H.

description: We used to go to the one on 30th and church, and the food was ok, but the manager or main waitress just made us feel unwelcome. it's a good location in the noe valley neighborhood with the opportunity to be a local's brunch spot, but it's a missed opportunity because you feel like you're in an airport chilies getting squished in and then shuffled out as quickly as possible.
author: Alyssa P.

description: This place has a really cool atmosphere and a wide variety on their menu - but I gave this place 2 stars for a couple reasons. I ordered the eggs Benedict which came with hash towns . The hash browns were under cooked and cold. The chicken apple sausage was delicious . The big no no for me was the service. Very inattentive and it took forever for us to be greeted. The mimosas were tiny and had pulp when the server said there wasn't any in there- obviously lacking knowledge. I unfortunately will not visit this location again .
author: Eric H.

description: Consistently solid. Still my go-to spot for a chill brunch. Great omelets, delicious hash browns, solid sourdough toast. Favorite: croissant French toast. One drawback: $2 for real maple syrup.
author: Kate C.

description:
If you love breakfast then you'll love Toast.

I love breakfast.

Therefore, I love Toast. 




Big portions and a combo with eggs, bacon, hash browns and pancakes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

That's the food I imagine Heaven serves.
author: Marisa R.

description:
I have eaten here before and it was really good.  I had the french toast made out of croissant.  That was a good dish.  This time i got the chocolate chip pancakes.  They were terrible.  The flavor was bland and the texture was rubbery. It was actually hard to cut it was so tough.  It was a very disappointing meal.  I did get a side of hash browns and they were delicious but come on, don't mess up pancakes!  They also charge $2 for maple syrup, who does that?  

For great pancakes go to Ella's or even Chow.  If you want the best pancakes I have ever had, go to Los Angeles and hit up Joe's for brunch on Abbot Kinney.  Ridiculous!
author: Mick M.

description:
Ham, eggs, hash browns, buttered wheat toast.....coffee, juice....ahhh....my perfect breakfast.  Quick and friendly service.  

First time here as I was visiting my sister who lives in the neighborhood and Im-so-mad-at-her-for-never-bringing-me-here-for-breakfast!! What a great neighborhood eatery. Can get a little crowded, but timing is everything.

Lots of families with kids, so if you want a quiet breakfast, this is not the place.
author: Glo F.

description:
Pretty standard breakfast fare with your standard set of sandwiches and stuff for lunch. Service is friendly but can be somewhat slow.

If there is anything of note to say about this place, its how well the food was plated. A lot of diner/brunch type places will just throw your food in a pile on the plate. This place goes a little farther and makes sure things are organized correctly. They also unwrap your butter slightly for you so its easier to access.
author: Will S.

description:
This is an old review From 11/12/10 and while I DO really like the food at Toast I think it's important comment about the customer service i received back then..

 It's not difficult to acknowledge a customer with simple eye contact when they sit down at the counter, even if the place is full... Just glance at  me or maybe a little smile. It's called customer service.   I've never felt so ignored or "iced" by a waitress.  Get a personality, b/c your food isn't THAT great.
author: Christine M.

description:
Went here around 10:30 on a Friday and didn't have to wait too long at all. 

Lox scrambler - lox, avocado, tomato, green onion, cream cheese, capers. $11.95
Maybe I was hungry or just really anticipating the smokey taste of cured salmon, whatever it is, i remember the first bite was really good!  I could definitely taste the different flavors of the lox, avocado, and on a nice fluffy bed of egg.   It was rich and filling, and had a side of hash browns and a choice of toasts.  For about $12, it was the scramble was enough for me being that I don't eat that much; I didn't get through much of the hash or toast.  You get a decent amount of lox and a pretty big dollop of cream cheese.  

Hash brown hill - hash, cheddar, sour cream, black olives, avocado, green onions.  $7.95
For the price you definitely get your money's worth, at least from what I could tell.  It's a pretty big mound of hash that's both soft --not mushy-- and that still has some crunch to it which I personally like.  My mom orders it every time we've gone.
author: Lindsay L.

description: Best Hash Browns ever. Love their scramblers and omeletes too. My husband really likes their burgers and wow, the bacon is so so good.
author: Niki A.

description: Decent food, but the coffee quality has gotten MUCH worse. If you're charging $3.25 for house coffee, you can certainly afford to offer something better.
author: Matt S.

description:
Where to begin. This might sound weird, but you could say i am somewhat of a milk shake connaisseur. I have traveled the land sampling this truly ninth wonder of the world, and have come to find this. I have enjoyed a torani bacon flavored milkshake in Alabama, buffalo-wing flavored in Kansas City, pancaked soy flavored in Tokyo, sweet potato flavored in Idaho, avocado flavored in Chile, butter chicken flavored in Mumbai, rau muong flavored in Vietnam, Vodka flavored(although looking back that might of been a white russian smoothie) in Moscow, and Kushari flavored in Egypt. However after tasting all of these incredibly unique milkshakes in every corner of the world, when asked by some of my esteemed colleagues which one was my favorite. I simply replied, The strawberry milkshake at Toast in the Noe Valley neighborhood of San Francisco. It had a thickness that was unparalleled. A creaminess second to none. A perfect Albion strawberry flavoring that would make the Queen of England step down. 
           Having said all that, that wasnt the only component that lead me to this decision. The final piece of the puzzle was the service. This little magenta masterpiece was served by this enchanting women named Erica. She was the friendliest, most professional little service assassin i have ever encountered. I also dont want to sound fresh here, but trust me, she was not too bad to look at either. she had a smile that would make the Dos Equis most interesting man in the world blush. I had breakfast there a week ago, and Erica's heartfelt handmade strawberry milkshake truly transcended the most magnificent mornings that this old chap cares to remember. Well done lassie!!
author: Pete P.

description:
I came here twice with a friend that recommended this place because he's so in love with Egg's Benedict.  My first time I tried the regular Egg's Benedict with Ham and hash browns.  It was good but I am not a fan of ham so the next visit, I tried the salmon egg's benedict without hash browns but with salad.  I was very satisfied!  Good customer service and quality food. I am willing to come back. =) 

Downfalls: Parking sucks because its a busy area and its within a residential area.  I also tried their Chai tea but I am not a fan of their Chai Tea because it had a weird spicy taste that I am not use to.
author: Sharjah M.

description:
Anyone who knows me knows that breakfast (or, more specifically, brunch) is my favorite meal.  Blame it on the mimosas, but I am probably as close as you will come to a certified brunchologist. 

When I'm in town, I frequent both the 24th Street and Church Street locations of Toast, although I have never ordered a mimosa here and don't know that they even have a liquor license.  (Really should check into that.)  They do have pretty much everything else -- from Mitchell's ice cream to cupcakes to dinner food made with fresh local ingredients.
